review_title: Very laid back management, not looking to improve things for patients or employees.
job_title: Registered Nurse in Miami Beach, FL
pros: Laid back management means less pressure to do everything you are supposed to do, which is great when everything you are supposed to do is humanely impossible. Im only 1 person. I truly have no idea what the culture in this hospital is other than laid back but I love the people I work with so ill stay as long as they stay because laid back management means nothing runs smoothly, everything is chaos, therefore, everything is 10× harder than it should be.
cons: Doctors don't properly follow up on patients as their notes claim therefore you have pissed off patients who haven't seen anyone in 12-36 hrs or patients who are declining because no one has come to see them. Low on supplies flowmeters, poles, pumps, suction, everything a room should already come with but have to be hunting for in emergency situation or rush-hour times which just makes working efficiently impossible. Poorly trained staff RNs, patient care techs and may I venture and say APRNs and Residents too. Management that only cares about admitting patients and filling up beds with no regards for nurses who are overworked (when no sufficient patient care techs or patient safety techs are available) forcing you to do PCT and RN work while at the same time having admissions back to back. One of the lowest paid hospitals in the area. Not a lot of senior staff after the pandemic so newbies learn from newbies. Hospital in crisis hiring from agencies where the nurses have questionable background experience and knowledge, meaning management is not really overseeing their new hired staff who are making patients sicker.

Improper use of power on executive level

job_title: Register Nurse in Miami Beach, FL
pros: Only good thing is gain of experience as a nurse
cons: Very unsafe place to work at . The assignments are ridiculous, manager one day asked me to take a 7th patient by force when it’s normally max 6 patients . Recognitions on the floor of the nurse of the week/month is all favoritism . If you don’t share your personal life info the management they treat you like you don’t exist . I felt very under appreciated after all the crazy assignments and mistakes they would do to me . I had only 8 more months to complete my 3 year contract and they wanted to still charge me The full 15,000 $ for internship , I couldn’t take this place anymore I felt very unsafe working here and the pay is not great . They are very stingy ! The manager literally drives away every single employee! Nurses are always leaving that floor , no one ever lasts there on that floor it’s always new employees getting hired , I wonder why ... there’s probably only 1-2 nurses who have actually stayed there for a while .

job_title: Specialty RN in Miami Beach, FL
pros: Diverse, a lot of employees are willing to put on the hard work to attempt to CARE for their patients and coworkers in a broken system.
cons: Management just does not seem to care about the employees input. You have to learn and stand up for yourself if not you'll be bullied by management or peers. Many employees are rude and don't care about improving the organization. A lot of the PCT's are just not willing to do the job and the "Attitude" is really such a downer to work with.

review_title: * Low Patient Census * Ill Mannered Customer Service *
job_title: Administrative in Miami Beach, FL
pros: Only Hospital in Miami Beach * Paid Time Off * Decent Medical Insurance*
cons:
We agree this organization is very corrupt.  It is an unethical organization and business procedures are not industry standard. 

Discrimination and other forms of harassment occur repeatedly by management. 
When employees do report unethical behavior to human resources, they are intimidated by their supervisors; Uncomfortable work environment and unfair work responsibilities. Nepotism, employees get discouraged.        
Patient Access, Security, and Safety departments are a joke, Lots of politics’, Poor training, low organization skills, and especially ill- mannered customer service. Managers and their supervisor’s daily involvement to cover up safety and security violations.  Security personnel not required to have state licenses. Supervisors spend most of their time on their cellular phones and delegate their responsibilities to others, No one seems to care.

review_title: It is a stressful and even chotic place to work.
job_title: Registered Nurse in Miami Beach, FL
pros: This is a place where a new nurse can learn a lot about nursing. You get to see different types of patients. The hospital is next to beautiful Biscayne Bay on Miami Beach. The views of the ocean and downtown Miami are simply awesome.
cons: You get a yearly raise of not even 2%. The medical benefits aren't that great. The PCTs on the floors tend to be lazy. It is difficult to get meds from pharmacy. Many employees in this hospital are quite rude, unfriendly, and unprofessional.

review_title: Used to be a great place to receive care
job_title: Registered Nurse in Miami Beach, FL
pros: Employees attempt to do the best they can in a very broken organization.  Onsite cafeteria and pharmacy.  Credit Union is onsite.
cons: Very little concern for the employees at large.  Senior and Middle Management project what they believe to be reality of the business environmnent.  Decisions are driven by god pod mentality.  Core business is patient care yet it is not the primary concern of senior management.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Miami, FL
pros: They offer benefits, I liked my coworkers, not much else nice to say about my employment term at this hospital

They are extremely racist and bias in the business office.

review_title: You will get your experience, but horrible company.
job_title: Registered Nurse in Miami Beach, FL
pros: You will get the experience and you will learn. They do not care if you call out often.  Opportunity for over time.
cons: This hospital is the worst paying hospital in south Florida. No opportunity to grow. Management sucks. Always under staffed. Only twenty cents raise yearly.

job_title: Patient Access in Aventura, FL
pros: Three days and 40 hours a week.
cons: In consistency in training schedule, management is not open to the experience an employee may have, wants the new hire to reset there experience. Definitely not the Sinai Way.

job_title: PI Coordinator in Miami Beach, FL
pros: great support from management, especially PI Director, support advancing education
cons: too much gossip in the department and overall hospital

job_title: Patient Access Representative in Miami Beach, FL
pros: Great working environment, PTO,  and management
cons: Compensation. High turnover.  Higher pay will keep employees longer

job_title: Training in Miami Beach, FL
pros: It was great to have onsite employee health benefits
cons: Working hours included 24 hour support. Sometimes in the middle of the night

job_title: Registered Nurse in Miami, FL
pros: It's an amazing hospital. Truly the best.
cons: It is far so it's not available to everyone.

job_title: RN Operating Room in Miami, FL
pros: meets schedule needs, best supervisors and managers
cons: rates are exclusive, very busy hospital

job_title: Registered Nurse in Miami Beach, FL
pros: Good benefits, very good opportunities for improvement
cons: Frequent cancellations, hospital is too big

job_title: Registered Nurse in Miami Beach, FL
pros: Staff was helpful for the most part
cons: Managers were detail oriented but rarely helped employees, poor pay

review_title: DO NOT COME HERE IF YOU VALUE LIFE.
job_title: Analyst in Miami, FL
pros: There is no Pros at all
cons: Dirty, everything is old and dingy. empoyees are complacent. Even the hospital sign on the building has missing letters at night...THEY DON'T CARE!!!

job_title: Pct in Miami Beach, FL
pros: Great coworkers great food
cons: Very low pay below average for pct Evs is making more

job_title: Resident in Miami Beach, FL
pros: Wonderful staff, beautiful hospital, excellent patient care and teaching.
cons: Difficult if you do not speak spanish

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Miami, FL
pros: Good experience, not micro managed
cons: You are just an employee ID #

Competitive salary and bonuses
accepts new graduates

location is far

job_title: Specialty RN in Miami, FL
pros: Friendly & positive environment for sure
cons: Benefits not so good & lack of material sometimes

job_title: Physician Assistant in Miami, FL
pros: Nursing staff is great. Nurses are very helpful and kind. There is a very diversify population. Some cases are very interesting. PAs and residents work together.
cons: As a PA, you have to work on weekends, holidays and being on-call for the same salary. There is also very poor management.

job_title: Medical Secretary in Miami, FL
pros: Good culture and nice working environment.
cons: Location if you do not live close.

job_title: Charge Nurse in Miami, FL
pros: Fellow staff, flexibility, scheduling,  location
cons: Management, patient ratios, cancelled frequently due to low census

job_title: Staff RN in Miami, FL
pros: Good place to start your nursing career!!!
cons: Expect visitors parking always full

job_title: RN Staff Nurse in Miami Beach, FL
pros: I liked the good teamwork
cons: Excessive workload and unrealistic expectations.
